WorkItem.ClosedComment: Should be fixed for next release.
WorkItem.Description: When I import from armory my Undead Mage, then click "Reconstruct Sequence", Rawr goes into "Not Responding" mode in Windows and I have to kill the task via task manager. I have tried this on three different machines (all running 64-bit Windows 7). Character XML file is attached.

Comments.Message:
I can't reproduce this. Here is what I see. After load the solution is showing ... indicating advanced solver in progress. I check reconstruct sequence and wait for advanced solver to finish. It ends at round 900 reaching the set computation limit and shows the message box informing of this. After that the solution is displayed, including the sequence reconstruction.

Can you explain a bit more in detail where your behavior starts to differ from this?

I went back to try to reproduce it with my existing file and I wasn't able to either.   However, I was able to re-create it by doing a fresh import again.  Here is a link to a 45 second screen cap I did showing you my steps.  The program will stay in that not responding state until I end it manually.  I've let it sit for over an hour, and I've been using Rawr for quite a while now so I have no expectations of anything being instant.     http://screencast.com/t/ZTMxY2RlY
